Package sprouts

Interface Result<V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Observable, Val<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ResultImpl
    public interface Result<V>
extends Val<V>
    A result is very similar to an Optional in that it can either contain a value or not, with the difference being that a result can also contain a list of Problems which describe what went wrong in the process of obtaining the value wrapped by the result. So usually, if the result is not present, there will most likely be a list of Problems explaining why the value is not present and what went wrong.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String ID  

      • Fields inherited from interface sprouts.Val

        DEFAULT_CHANNEL, EMPTY, ID_PATTERN, NO_ID

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default boolean hasProblems()
      Checks if this result has Problems associated with it.
      Result<V> map​(java.util.function.Function<V,​V> mapper)
      Safely maps the value of this result to a new value of the same type even if an exception is thrown during the mapping process, in which case the exception is caught and a new result is returned with the exception as a problem.
      <U> Result<U> mapTo​(java.lang.Class<U> type, java.util.function.Function<V,​U> mapper)
      Safely maps the value of this result to a new value of a different type even if an exception is thrown during the mapping process, in which case the exception is caught and a new result is returned with the exception as a problem.
      static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type)
      A factory method for creating an empty result without a value and no problems.
      static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type, @Nullable V value)
      A factory method for creating a result with a potentially null value but no problems.
      static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type, @Nullable V value, java.util.List<Problem> problems)
      A factory method for creating a result with a potentially null value and a list of problems.
      static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type, java.util.List<Problem> problems)
      A factory method for creating an empty result and a list of problems.
      static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type, Problem problem)
      A factory method for creating a result with a single problem.
      static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type, V value, Problem problem)
      A factory method for creating an optional result with a single problem.
      static <V> Result<V> of​(V value)
      A factory method for creating a result with a non-null value and no problems.

      A factory method for creating a list based result from the given list.

      • of

        static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type)
        A factory method for creating an empty result without a value and no problems.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the value, which may not be null.
        Returns:
        An empty result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the type is null.

      • of

        static <V> Result<V> of​(V value)
        A factory method for creating a result with a non-null value and no problems.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to wrap in the result.
        Returns:
        A result with the given value and no problems.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value is null.

      • of

        static <V> Result<V> of​(java.lang.Class<V> type,
                        @Nullable V value)
        A factory method for creating a result with a potentially null value but no problems. Some results may be empty without that being a problem, so this method is useful for creating results that may be empty but are not necessarily problematic.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the value, which may not be null.
        value - The value to wrap in the result or null to create an empty result.
        Returns:
        A result with the given value and no problems.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the type is null.

      • of

        static <V> Result<V> of​(V value,
                        java.util.List<Problem> problems)
        A factory method for creating a result with a non-null value and a list of problems.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to wrap in the result, which may not be null.
        problems - The list of problems associated with the result.
        Returns:
        A result with the given value and problems.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value or problems are null.

      • ofList

        static <V> Result<java.util.List<V>> ofList​(java.lang.Class<V> type,
                                            java.util.List<V> list)
        A factory method for creating a list based result from the given list. The list may be empty but not null.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the list elements.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the list value, which may not be null. This is the type of the list elements, not the type of the list itself.
        list - The list to wrap in the result.
        Returns:
        A result with the given list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null.

      • ofList

        static <V> Result<java.util.List<V>> ofList​(java.lang.Class<V> type,
                                            java.util.List<V> list,
                                            java.util.List<Problem> problems)
        A factory method for creating a list based result from the given list and problems. The list may be empty but not null.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the list elements.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the list value, which may not be null. This is the type of the list elements, not the type of the list itself.
        list - The list to wrap in the result.
        problems - The list of problems associated with the result.
        Returns:
        A result with the given list and problems.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null.

      • ofTry

        static <V> Result<V> ofTry​(java.lang.Class<V> type,
                           java.util.function.Supplier<V> supplier)
        A factory method for creating a result from a Supplier which may throw an exception. If the supplier throws an exception, the exception is caught and a new result is returned with the exception as a problem.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of the value returned from the supplier.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the value returned from the supplier.
        supplier - The supplier to obtain the value from.
        Returns:
        A new result with the value obtained from the supplier and a list of problems describing related issues.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the type or supplier is null.

      • problems

        java.util.List<Problem> problems()
        Exposes a list of Problems associated with this result item. A problem is a description of what went wrong in the process of obtaining the value wrapped by this result.

        Note that a result may be present but still have problems, in which case the problems list is not empty.

        Returns:
        The list of Problems associated with this result item.

      • hasProblems

        default boolean hasProblems()
        Checks if this result has Problems associated with it. A problem is a description of what went wrong in the process of obtaining the value wrapped by this result.

        Note that a result may be present but still have problems, in which case the problems list is not empty.

        Returns:
        true if this result is present, false otherwise.

      • mapTo

        <U> Result<U> mapTo​(java.lang.Class<U> type,
                    java.util.function.Function<V,​U> mapper)
        Safely maps the value of this result to a new value of a different type even if an exception is thrown during the mapping process, in which case the exception is caught and a new result is returned with the exception as a problem.
        Specified by:
        mapTo in interface Val<V>
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the item returned from the mapping function.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the item returned from the mapping function.
        mapper - The mapping function to apply to an item, if present.
        Returns:
        A new result with the mapped value and a list of problems describing related issues.

        Result<V> map​(java.util.function.Function<V,​V> mapper)
